line_1: The Saint, the Father, and the Husband prays:
line_2: That thus they all shall meet in future days:

line_1: The Saint, the Father, and the Husband prays:
line_2: There, ever bask in uncreated rays,

line_1: The Saint, the Father, and the Husband prays:
And one that wears a coronet and prays;
line_2: We boast some rich ones whom the gospel sways,

line_1: In health, in sickness, thus the suppliant prays;
line_2: Enlarge my life with multitude of days,

line_1: Long may they last, Flirtilla prays,
line_2: To live in these enlighten'd days

line_1: His God is present still, and hears him when he prays.
line_2: RATHER than sink, said I, attempt to raise

line_1: His God is present still, and hears him when he prays.
line_2: My Hopes, nor talk of Ceremonial Days;
May be as heavy as the Case:

line_1: What widow or what orphan prays
line_2: To crown thy life with length of days?

line_1: The gallant soph for quiet prays,
line_2: With thoughts engross'd by routs and plays,

line_1: Is sober, meek, benevolent, and prays;
line_2: Has wept a silent flood, revers'd his ways,

line_1: Your humble Bardie sings an' prays
line_2: God bless your Honors, a' your days,

line_1: Your humble Bardie sings an' prays
line_2: Wi' sowps o' kail and brats o' claise,

line_1: Your humble Bardie sings an' prays
line_2: In spite o' a' the thievish kaes
